definition: to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.chinese: 上校集合士兵列队接受检阅。

sentences.english: The students trooped behind the teacher into the museum.
sentences.chinese: 学生列队跟着老师走进博物馆。

sentences.english: The soldiers are standing in a row.
sentences.chinese: 战士们正列队站成一横排。

sentences.english: Thousands of people lined the processional mute.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的人站在列队行进路线的两旁。

sentences.english: Two hundred Japanese school kids paraded past us at one point.
sentences.chinese: 某个时刻，有两百名日本学生列队经过我们身边。

sentences.english: The students trooped into the classroom.
They threw their chests out when marching in parade.
sentences.chinese: 他们在列队行进时都挺起了胸膛。

sentences.english: The competitors march around the stadium and then form up in the center of the ground facing the tribune.
sentences.chinese: 参赛者绕场一周，然后在场地中央面对主席台列队。

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯带着镣铐被押着列队游街示众。

sentences.english: The ship's company line up on the quayside for the commissioning ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船的船员在码头列队准备进行入水仪式。

sentences.english: An army of penguins paraded along the beach .
sentences.chinese: 一群企鹅沿海滨列队行进。

sentences.english: I’ll never forget the next time my class lined up at the monkey bars.
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会忘记全班再次列队站在猴架旁的情景。

sentences.english: Monks file to prayer in the Shaolin Temple.
sentences.chinese: 少林寺中的和尚们在列队祷告。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people filed past the body of the dead leader, to pay their last respects.
sentences.chinese: 成千上百的人列队缓缓经过领袖的遗体，向他告别。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the main streets.
sentences.chinese: 被抓获的犯人列队游街示众。

sentences.english: The children trooped into the park.

definition: to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to line the streets in welcome
fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
